alert.note: Alert for Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 17 at 10:40AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following area, Northern Inner Channels. This includes the city of Skagway. * WHEN...Until 10 PM AKDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. Heavy rainfall may increase the risk of rock slide activity near the Skagway dock. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall of 0.50 to 1 inch has already fallen across the region. A brief lull in the heavier rainfall through Wednesday morning will give way to the next increase in rain associated with the atmospheric river moving through this afternoon. An Additional 0.75 to 1.25 inches are possible. Rises on the rivers and streams are evident and the potential for flooding on rivers other than the Taiya remains possible. The Taiya River has been upgraded to a warning. Please see the appropriate product for that information.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
